content.description:
Start on the snout on the right side northwest face of the rock.  Move left on a series of shelfs until they disappear. Then use the slabby top of the rock for hands as you continue left.  The feet start to get worse unti you finally reach the tail, where a mantle finishes the problem.

You may also chose to continue traversing around the corner and finish on 'Back and Forth' (V0+) but that makes for a much less safe finish.

Keeping your hands below the slab on the traverse probably ups the grade to V5.
content.protection: Hard landing, but you're so close to the ground you dont even need a pad!

content.description:
The only route on the east face of the rock.

Start on the left side on a low shelf and traverse right.  Lunge up to the top shelf and traverse back left before mantle on the left-most side of the rock.

Don't fuck up the mantel. There's a big sharp rock beneath ya!
content.protection: Difficult to protect the finish without a bunch of pads.
